title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION POLICIES

description.narrative: Protection policy framwork is emproved and the suport to coordination mechanism is strenghthened, which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable children and child victims of exploitation, trafficking, violence and harmful practices are identified and protected by holistic, equitable policy interventions that are responsive to their individual needs, including in humanitarian situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Protection policy framwork is emproved and the suport to coordination mechanism is strenghthened

description.narrative: The new penal code adopted by the country’s parliament on 29 December 2020, was promulgated by the President of the Union of the Comoros on 16 February 2021. UNICEF provided funding for many activities, such as the compilation of two detailed and simplified collections of texts relating to the protection of children and women, the activities to distribute these collections among 1,000 state and non-state actors in charge of the protection of children, and women and around 5,000 students and adolescents in 28 of the 54 municipalities of the country. | Status:Met | As-of Date:10/01/2022
